arcanianCryptids.description: A swift, horned hare said to be imbued with trickster magic and uncanny luck.
A ghostly child of the cranberry marshes, adept at slipping between the living world and the spirit realm.
A hulking forest wanderer whose gentle wisdom belies its formidable strength and stealth.
Descended from woodland spirits, these lithe folk blend into the trees and wield primal protean powers.
A winged cryptid whose glowing eyes pierce darkness, oft‑said to foretell calamity or salvation.
A towering, frost‑haunted being whose hunger for life force grants uncanny resilience.
A fiendish flyer from the pine barrens, expert at hit‑and‑run tactics and weaving through dense woods.

arcanianHumanoids.description: Buffalo‑headed guardians of the plains, broad‑shouldered and unyielding—symbols of herd endurance.
Salmon‑scaled amphibians of river and pool, swift swimmers and secret‑ford guides.
Vulture‑folk of sun‑baked canyons, silent scavengers who uncover both carrion and hidden truths.
Six‑winged, luminescent angel‑beings born of starfire—celestial heralds who bridge mortals and Wardens.
Ethereal fey‑kin of misty groves, masters of illusion and woodland wards.
Peachpunk gnome‑engineers, ever‑tinkering with cider‑fueled contraptions that push the frontier forward.
Grizzly‑folk champions of the Brown Bear Republic, mountain‑forged and fiercely territorial.

Humans.description: Rugged seafarers and hill‑folk, famed for stout longships, disciplined knights, and fog‑shrouded moors.
Vineyard‑keepers and forest‑dwellers with mastery of herbal lore, guerrilla tactics, and clan‑based senate rule.
Sun‑bleached conquistadors and baroque nobles whose cavalry circles battlefields like fire beneath gold‑embroidered plumes.

Elves.description: City‑elves of smoky forges and glass‑blown spires — mechanists and alchemists fusing arcane magic with artifice.
River‑land gardeners famed for floating barge‑markets, wine‑red silks, and waterglyph poetry.
Courtly duelists and patron‑elves of sculpture and fresco, setting fashion for blade and song across the Empyrean.

Gnomes.description: Theocratic technologists venerating a pantheon of gear‑gods, their steam‑temples churn out clockwork priests and divine engines.
Highland tinkers and cider‑press innovators, ever‑braided and goggled, racing kegs and crafting peach‑fueled engines.
